Articles.Content: So ive seen When we Left Earth, Shadow of the Moon and other space race documentaries. Those two so far are my favorites. But still.. they lacked a few details. Im looking for a long, detailed boring documentary that covers just about everything. So what are you favorites?
Here's one - The Red Stuff. It's not boring, but it isn't hardware oriented. It's interviews with famous Cosmonauts. I enjoyed it.

Thanks ill check it out. Here another one I liked that I stumbled upon called Engines from the Cold. I like it because they cover the N1. Something about these old, gritty documentaries lol. Idk what this games doing to me 5 years ago these would've put me to sleep now its all I wanna watch.

Yep, forgot about that one. Enjoyed it too. Was fantastic when those 33's roared to life. And all KSP is doing is awakening in you your natural curiosity, your desire to achieve and ability to dream. Oh and if you build rockets like me, your love of a rip-roaring explosion.
